item.title: Address Space
item.description: Abstract Â§ A list of memory locations from 0 to some maximum (Virtual Memory), which Process can read & write 3 Components 3 Components Â§ Stack Segment Â§ Stack (FILO) structure Grows downwards The expansion and shrinking are done automatically Can be used to store function variables XV6-RISCV Kernel Stack Example Â§ // xv6-riscv kernel codes, start.

item.title: Registers
item.description: Abstract Â§ A group of Latch Accessible from Instruction 2 main purposes Â§ Storying values during computations (like Memory Address & value) Configuring CPU Register Type Â§ Instruction Address Register Â§ The register that contains the Memory Address to retrieve the Instruction Instruction Register Â§ Contains Instruction retrieved from Main Memory Control & Status Registers (CSRs) Â§ There are multiple such register Stores information about the current state of the processor or device CSRs are typically used to control various aspects of the processorâ€™s operation, such as interrupt handling, memory management, and power management etc Stack Pointer Â§ Holds the address of the top of the Stack Segment in the current execution context MIPS Registers Â§ Terminologies Â§ Width Â§ The number of Bits inside a register File Â§ A collection of registers that CPU can quickly store and retrieve Data Memory Mapped Â§ Register that is treated as a Main Memory location This means that the register can be accessed using the same Instruction and addressing modes as memory.

item.title: Network Protocol
item.description: Abstract Â§ The Host Host Quote Definites the format and the order of messages exchanged between 2 or more communicating entities, as well as actions taken on the transmission and/or receipt of a message or other event .

item.title: Host
item.description: Abstract Â§ Also known as End System Computers & other devices connected to Internet, thus has a Socket Interface Connected together by a network of Communication Links & Packet Switches Can be identified by Hostname or IP Address 2 types Â§ Client Â§ Desktops, laptops & smartphones, browsers etc Server Â§ Host applications such as web browser program Web servers etc .

item.title: Process Management
item.description: Abstract Â§ Required in an OS that has multiple Process that want to run at the same, like in the Multi-Programming or Multitasking systems. Because Process unlike Thread will give up its CPU for other Process Components Â§ Process Priority Â§ A value that determines which Process should get executed first Process Scheduler Â§ A program that perform Context Switch of Process based on the Process Priority Linux uses CFS Terminologies Â§ Niceness Â§ An parameter that can be used to adjust the Process Priority for the Process Scheduler In Linux -20 is most not nice 19 is most nice Command to adjust niceness - renice .

item.title: Process
item.description: Abstract Â§ Container that holds all the information needed to run a program, Abstraction over running program 2 Components - Address Space, Process Control Block (PCB) Process usually donâ€™t share Main Memory among themselves for isolation purposes.

item.title: Node.js
item.description: Abstract Â§ Not a Programming Language or Server Is a JavaScript Runtime Environment Terminologies Â§ JavaScript Runtime Environment Â§ A environment to run Javascript, independent of Browser Module Â§ Basically JavaScript Module The methods to be explicitly exposed, there are mainly 3 ways module.

item.title: brk()
item.description: #os Specifies the new Memory Address where the Address Space is to end Not defined in Portable Operating System Interface (POSIX) Programmer encouraged to use malloc .
